summary: Applies the effects as seen in Mortal Enemies and Attack Commitment to Mihail Monsters.
descriptionHtml:
[b][u][color=#ffe599][size=3][center][/center][/size][/color][/u][/b][quote][b][u][color=#ffe599][size=4][/size][/color][/u][/b][center][b][u][size=4]
[color=#ffe599]﻿[/color][b][u][color=#ffe599]You MUST d[/color][/u][/b][b][u][b][u][color=#ffe599]ownload the[/color][/u][/b][/u][/b][b][u][b][u][color=#ffe599][b][u][b][u][color=#ffe599] monster from [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/37834630]MihailMods's page[/url]﻿. I only provide the ESP file. His file will provide textures/meshes/sounds/etc.[/color][/u][/b][/u][/b][/color][/u][/b][/u][/b][/size][/u][/b][b][u][color=#f9cb9c][size=4]

This mod was intended to be used with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/73921]Mortal Enemies[/url]﻿ / [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/70079]Attack Commitment[/url]﻿ and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/20923]TK Dodge[/url]﻿.[/size][/color][/u][/b][/center][/quote][size=3][b][u][center][/center][/u][/b]
This mod affects:

[/size][list]
[*][size=3]Unarmed Reach[/size]
[*][size=3]Angular Acceleration Rate[/size]
[*][size=3]Acceleration/Deceleration Rate[/size]
[*][size=3]Attack Angle [/size]
[*][size=3]Strike Angle[/size]
[*][size=3]Angle Aim Tolerance (rarely)[/size]
[/list][quote][color=#ffffff][size=4][center]To [b]INSTALL [/b]a [b]single[/b] monster ESP[b],[/b][/center][/size][/color][size=3]
[/size][list=1]
[*][size=3]Download any Mihail Monster found in the list below.[/size]
[*][size=3]Download the appropriate ESP in my downloads section.[/size]
[*][size=3]Follow the directions below based on your mod manager.[/size]
[/list][/quote][size=3]
If you are using [b][color=#00ffff]Mod Organizer[/color] [/b](if you do it this way, you will only have to deal with 1 ESP and 1 mod on the left),[/size]
[size=3]
(a) Place this mod [u]AFTER[/u] the Monster in your load order.
(b) [u]Delete[/u] the original ESP. (Right click on the mod to the left, Left Click "information", Left Click "file tree", Right Click on the ESP, Left Click "delete")[/size]

[size=3][color=#ffffff]If you are using [/color][b][color=#ff7700]Nexus Mod Manager[/color][/b][color=#ffffff],[/color][/size]

[size=3](a) Be sure to [u]download[/u] the monster first.
(b) [u]Overwrite[/u] the monster file with my mod (my ESP will automatically replace his ESP).[/size]
[color=#ffffff]
[/color][quote][color=#ffffff][size=4][center]To [b]INSTALL[/b] a [b]merged[/b] monster ESP,[/center][/size][/color][/quote][size=3][color=#ffffff]
If you are using [/color][b][color=#00ffff]Mod Organizer[/color][/b][color=#ffffff] (if you do it this way, you will only have to deal with 1 ESP and 1 mod on the left),[/color][/size]
[size=3]
(a) Place this mod [u]AFTER[/u] the Monster in your load order.
(b) [u]Delete[/u] the original ESP. (Right click on the mod to the left, Left Click "information", Left Click "file tree", Right Click on the ESP, Left Click "delete")

[color=#ffffff]If you are using [/color][b][color=#ff7700]Nexus Mod Manager[/color][/b][color=#ffffff],[/color]

(a) Be sure to [u]download [/u][u]all[/u] of the monsters in the pack first.
(b) [u]Download[/u] and [u]activate[/u] my mod as usual.
(c) [u]Overwrite[/u] the monster files with my mod (my ESPs will automatically replace his ESPs).

[/size][quote][color=#93c47d][size=4][b][/b][/size][/color][center][color=#93c47d][size=4][b]﻿[b]I will be adding + updating monsters as time passes. I only have these (below) for now.[/b][/b][/size][/color][b][color=#ea9999][size=4]

(If you don't see what you want, request it in the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88456?tab=posts]comments[/url]﻿)[/size][/color][/b][/center][/quote][size=3][color=#ffffff][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/85022]
Ancient Nordic Sentinel[/url][/color] (ESO)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/84353]Bolgans[/url] (Witcher)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87148]Bone Colossus[/url] (ESO) ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/82055]Dwarven Colossus[/url] (ESO)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/85364]Centaurs[/url]﻿ (TES II)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87105]Cliff Racers[/url] (TES III)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87786]Cyclops[/url] (Dragon's Dogma)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88477]Cyrodilic Minotaurs[/url] (TES IV)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87049]Dragonlings[/url] (TES II)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/82614]Drakian Hydra[/url] (Mihail's Original Creation?)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88264]Dryads[/url] (TES IV)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/82055]Dwarven Colossus[/url] (ESO)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88088]Enemy Bats[/url] (TES II)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/84995]Flesh Atronach[/url] (TES IV)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/84516]Foglings[/url] (Witcher)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88294]Giant Snakes[/url] (ESO)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/82505]Giant Wasps[/url] (ESO)  -- Now is re-balanced! [reduced level, hp, poison, damage multipliers]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/82177]Gravelords[/url] (Dark Souls)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87822]Grievous Twilight[/url] (ESO)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/82259]Harvesters[/url] (ESO)

[url=https://rd.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/89168]Hungers and Vermais[/url] (TES Universe)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87992]Iron Atronach[/url] (ESO)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87864]Kagouti[/url] (TES III)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/84681]Land Dreughs[/url] (TES IV)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/81998]Minotaurs[/url] (TES IV)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88007]Mountain Lions[/url] (TES IV)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/86934]Mournful Aegis[/url] (ESO)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87662]Nemesis[/url] (Resident Evil)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87423]Nix-Creatures[/url] (TES III)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/84426]Old Gods of the Hunt[/url] (Witcher)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88188]Ogres[/url] (TES IV)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87505]Pyramid Head[/url] (Silent Hill)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88439]Rotten Maidens[/url] (Witcher)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88547]Spider Daedra[/url] (TES IV)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87957]Storm Golem[/url] (ESO)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87008]Terror Birds[/url] (Megafauna)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/85492]Vampire Beasts[/url] (Witcher)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87210]Water Hags[/url] (Witcher)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87163]Wolves of Cyrodiil[/url] (TES IV)
[center][color=#d5a6bd]﻿[b]
[/b][/color][quote][b][color=#ffe599]The following monsters DO NOT NEED MY MOD and are AFFECTED BY [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/73921]MORTAL ENEMIES[/url]﻿ or [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/70079]ATTACK COMMITMENT[/url]﻿[/color][/b][/quote][/center]
[b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87928]Imps[/url][/b] (TES IV)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87638]Wicked Witch[/url] (Witcher)

[line][/size][center][size=3][size=3]
[color=#dd7e6b]﻿[b][u]Recommended Mods[/u][/b][/color][/size][/size][/center][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/73921]
Mortal Enemies - De-aimbot Your Foes[/url] (Covers Humans + Creatures [b]|[/b] More lenient turning than Attack Commitment)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/70079]Attack Commitment No turning during attacks[/url] (Covers only Humans [b]|[/b] More restricted turning than Mortal Enemies)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/20923]TK Dodge[/url] (Allows dodging)

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17491]D13 Faster GET UP STAND UP animation vanilla friendly[/url] (Helps you get up and fight these monsters especially if you are using other combat mods)[/size]
author: ItsPhoOclock
